verses.verse: My son,<WH1121> if<WH518> thou be surety<WH6148> for thy friend,<WH7453> if thou hast stricken<WH8628> thy hand<WH3709> with a stranger,<WH2114>
Thou art snared<WH3369> with the words<WH561> of thy mouth,<WH6310> thou art taken<WH3920> with the words<WH561> of thy mouth.<WH6310>

Do <WH6213> this<WH2063> now,<WH645> my son,<WH1121> and deliver thyself,<WH5337> when<WH3588> thou art come<WH935> into the hand<WH3709> of thy friend;<WH7453> go,<WH1980> humble thyself,<WH7511> and make sure<WH7292> thy friend.<WH7453>
Give <WH5414> not<WH408> sleep<WH8142> to thine eyes,<WH5869> nor slumber<WH8572> to thine eyelids.<WH6079>
Deliver thyself<WH5337> as a roe<WH6643> from the hand<WH4480> <WH3027> of the hunter, and as a bird<WH6833> from the hand<WH4480> <WH3027> of the fowler.<WH3353>
Go <WH1980> to<WH413> the ant,<WH5244> thou sluggard;<WH6102> consider<WH7200> her ways,<WH1870> and be wise: <WH2449>
Which <WH834> having no<WH369> guide,<WH7101> overseer,<WH7860> or ruler,<WH4910>
Provideth <WH3559> her meat<WH3899> in the summer,<WH7019> and gathereth<WH103> her food<WH3978> in the harvest.<WH7105>
How long<WH5704> <WH4970> wilt thou sleep,<WH7901> O sluggard?<WH6102> when<WH4970> wilt thou arise<WH6965> out of thy sleep?<WH4480> <WH8142>
Yet a little<WH4592> sleep,<WH8142> a little<WH4592> slumber,<WH8572> a little<WH4592> folding<WH2264> of the hands<WH3027> to sleep: <WH7901>
So shall thy poverty<WH7389> come<WH935> as one that traveleth,<WH1980> and thy want<WH4270> as an armed<WH4043> man.<WH376>
A naughty<WH1100> person,<WH120> a wicked<WH205> man,<WH376> walketh<WH1980> with a froward<WH6143> mouth.<WH6310>
He winketh<WH7169> with his eyes,<WH5869> he speaketh<WH4448> with his feet,<WH7272> he teacheth<WH3384> with his fingers;<WH676>
Frowardness <WH8419> is in his heart,<WH3820> he deviseth<WH2790> mischief<WH7451> continually;<WH3605> <WH6256> he soweth<WH7971> discord.<WH4066>
Therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> shall his calamity<WH343> come<WH935> suddenly;<WH6597> suddenly<WH6621> shall he be broken<WH7665> without<WH369> remedy.<WH4832>
These <WH2007> six<WH8337> things doth the LORD<WH3068> hate:<WH8130> yea, seven<WH7651> are an abomination<WH8441> unto him: <WH5315>
A proud<WH7311> look,<WH5869> a lying<WH8267> tongue,<WH3956> and hands<WH3027> that shed<WH8210> innocent<WH5355> blood,<WH1818>
A heart<WH3820> that deviseth<WH2790> wicked<WH205> imaginations,<WH4284> feet<WH7272> that be swift<WH4116> in running<WH7323> to mischief,<WH7451>
A false<WH8267> witness<WH5707> that speaketh<WH6315> lies,<WH3577> and he that soweth<WH7971> discord<WH4090> among<WH996> brethren.<WH251>
My son,<WH1121> keep<WH5341> thy father's<WH1> commandment,<WH4687> and forsake<WH5203> not<WH408> the law<WH8451> of thy mother: <WH517>
Bind <WH7194> them continually<WH8548> upon<WH5921> thine heart,<WH3820> and tie<WH6029> them about<WH5921> thy neck.<WH1621>
When thou goest,<WH1980> it shall lead<WH5148> thee;<WH853> when thou sleepest,<WH7901> it shall keep<WH8104> <WH5921> thee; and when thou awakest,<WH6974> it<WH1931> shall talk<WH7878> with thee.
For <WH3588> the commandment<WH4687> is a lamp;<WH5216> and the law<WH8451> is light;<WH216> and reproofs<WH8433> of instruction<WH4148> are the way<WH1870> of life: <WH2416>
To keep<WH8104> thee from the evil<WH7451> woman,<WH4480> <WH802> from the flattery<WH4480> <WH2513> of the tongue<WH3956> of a strange woman.<WH5237>
Lust <WH2530> not<WH408> after her beauty<WH3308> in thine heart;<WH3824> neither<WH408> let her take<WH3947> thee with her eyelids.<WH6079>

For <WH3588> by means<WH1157> of a whorish<WH2181> woman<WH802> a man is brought to<WH5704> a piece<WH3603> of bread:<WH3899> and the adulteress<WH802> <WH376> will hunt<WH6679> for the precious<WH3368> life.<WH5315>
Can a man<WH376> take<WH2846> fire<WH784> in his bosom,<WH2436> and his clothes<WH899> not<WH3808> be burned?<WH8313>
Can <WH518> one<WH376> go<WH1980> upon<WH5921> hot coals,<WH1513> and his feet<WH7272> not<WH3808> be burned?<WH3554>
So <WH3651> he that goeth in<WH935> to<WH413> his neighbor's<WH7453> wife;<WH802> whosoever<WH3605> toucheth<WH5060> her shall not<WH3808> be innocent.<WH5352>
Men do not<WH3808> despise<WH936> a thief,<WH1590> if<WH3588> he steal<WH1589> to satisfy<WH4390> his soul<WH5315> when<WH3588> he is hungry;<WH7456>
But if he be found,<WH4672> he shall restore<WH7999> sevenfold;<WH7659> he shall give<WH5414> <WH853> all<WH3605> the substance<WH1952> of his house.<WH1004>
But whoso committeth adultery<WH5003> with a woman<WH802> lacketh<WH2638> understanding:<WH3820> he<WH1931> that doeth<WH6213> it destroyeth<WH7843> his own soul.<WH5315>
A wound<WH5061> and dishonor<WH7036> shall he get;<WH4672> and his reproach<WH2781> shall not<WH3808> be wiped away.<WH4229>
For <WH3588> jealousy<WH7068> is the rage<WH2534> of a man:<WH1397> therefore he will not<WH3808> spare<WH2550> in the day<WH3117> of vengeance.<WH5359>
He will not<WH3808> regard<WH6440> <WH5375> any<WH3605> ransom;<WH3724> neither<WH3808> will he rest content,<WH14> though<WH3588> thou givest many<WH7235> gifts.<WH7810>
